textbooks.title: The Surprising Power of Liberating Structures: Simple Rules to Unleash a Culture of Innovation

assignments: Moonwalk 1: Lead an exercise outside of class – post a video testimonial.

topics: Organizational Climate vs. Organizational Culture (SO WHAT)

assignments: Moonwalk 2: Delivery—Lead 3 collaboration activities outside of class

topics: Integrating Collaborative Practices at Work - Part 1 (NOW WHAT)
Integrating Collaborative Practices at Work - Part 2 (NOW WHAT)

breakdown.assignments: 10 points for Moonwalk 1, 10 points for Team A, 10 points for Team B, 10 points for Team C, 10 points for Team D, 20 points for Moonwalk 2

assignments.description: Moonwalk 1: Lead an exercise outside of class – post a video testimonial.
Sandbox Time: Happens outside class and share in learning journal.
Moonwalk 2 Design: Design 3 collaboration activities you’ll lead outside class.
Moonwalk 2: Delivery—Lead 3 collaboration activities outside of class and respond to reflection questions in your learning journal.

policies.attendance: 0 points if you miss more than 2 classes.
policies.academic_integrity: You must cite all references for your written ideas and use quotation marks for all direct quotes from other resources.

additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

_metadata.pdf_source: ../StevensCourses\2022 MGT 695 A Syllabus - Leading Creat Collab - Ancowitz v1.pdf
_metadata.course_description: This course builds individual awareness of creativity and collaboration skills while increasing your capacity for both.
learning_outcomes: Communicate the value of enhancing a group’s or organization's creative and collaborative skills and mentor others to build and use these skills at work
Design and facilitate effective group ideation and problem-solving events
Confidently engage others in productive creative abrasion to make the best use of the diversity of perspectives on a team
Motivate yourself and others to address problems that have long been tolerated or accepted as unsolvable attributes of the status quo
Assess key attributes of an organization's culture so you can influence the architectural, interpersonal, and philosophical systems that undermine innovation
Set personal standards and priorities for yourself as leaders committed to exceptional group creativity and collaboration, and monitor your own continued practice and growth
Lead others to address meaningful problems and possibilities everywhere you find them
